Microssa

Class PriceSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • Microssa.PriceSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class PriceSocket
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class creates a TCP socket interface to allow market data subscribe/unsubscribe requests to be sent to the MatchingEngine. The MatchingEngine replies with snapshots of the current prices in the books. This socket runs on its own thread.
    See Also:
    MatchingEngine

        private java.lang.String OutputBuffer
        Buffered output to be written to the connection.

      • ErrorCount

        private int ErrorCount
        Number of erroneous messages. Three in a row results in a disconnect.

      • PingMS

        private int PingMS
        Milliseconds between PING messages. These messages can be ignored on the client side.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PriceSocket

        public PriceSocket(java.lang.String Name,
                   MatchingEngine me)
        The constructor stores information for when the Thread is started, but does not start it on its own.
        Parameters:
        Name - A string identifier for the future Thread
        me - A reference to the MatchingEngine this socket is supposed to connect

    • Method Detail

      • WriteReply

        public void WriteReply(java.lang.String s)
        Interface for the MatchingEngine to queue a reply on the connection.
        Parameters:
        s - The message to be sent out

      • ProcessInput

        private java.lang.String ProcessInput(java.lang.String InputLine)
        Parses the input received on the connection. Will disconnect when receiving a "BYE", otherwise will attempt to parse the message as a subscribe/unsubscribe request. If all fails, returns an error message and increments the ErrorCount. Disconnects if there are three consecutive errors.
        Parameters:
        InputLine - The message received on the connection
        Returns:
        An error message, or blank string if there was no error

      • run

        public void run()
        Notifies the MatchingEngine that this socket exists. Opens the PortNumber and listens for connections. Establishes connections and reads/writes data. This function never exits, which requires killing Microssa to stop.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the Thread. Sends a message to Logger to indicate successful start and as to which PortNumber it is listening.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Passthrough from Logger
